docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Re ''Details of Hospital Proposal Show Far Wider Cuts'' (front page, Nov. 29): The recommendations by the Commission on Health Care Facilities in the 21st Century to close, merge or shrink hospitals to control skyrocketing health care costs reflect a misguided strategy of bashing the providers of health care -- hospitals, doctors and hospital staff -- as the primary means to contain cost.

headline.main: Can We Afford to Close Hospitals?

docs.abstract: Five letters comment on Nov 29 article on plan to shrink New York State's hospital industry; Dr Paul Aaronson says recommendations to close or merge hospitals reflects misguided strategy of bashing health care providers as primary means to contain cost; Harriet Harris says taking away hospitals would only add to already existing problems; Kristen Johnson applauds recommendations of Commission on Health Care Facilities in 21st Century; Alan Sager and Debbie Socolar say saving money requires focus on New York's health spending that goes to unnecessary care, paperwork, excess prices and theft; Dr Jay A Motola says closing some institutions will only redistribute costs among wealthier institutions and calls for re-evaluating insurance companies
docs.snippet: To the Editor:     Re ''Details of Hospital Proposal Show Far Wider Cuts'' (front page, Nov. 29):      The recommendations by the Commission on Health Care Facilities in the 21st Century to close, merge or shrink hospitals to control skyrocketing...
